holidays.name: Z Day
holidays.description: A quirky celebration dedicated to all things starting with the letter Z‚Äîthink zebras, zippers, and zen! It's a fun way to kick off the year focusing on the often-overlooked last letter of the alphabet.
holidays.origin: An unofficial holiday created by enthusiasts of alphabet-themed fun, aiming to highlight the uniqueness of 'Z' each year on New Year's Day.
holidays.funFact: Did you know? The letter Z is the only letter in the English alphabet not used as the first letter of any chemical element.

holidays.name: Global Family Day
holidays.description: A peaceful and heartwarming observance encouraging people around the world to come together as one human family and promote kindness and harmony.
holidays.origin: Conceived after the Gulf War in the early 1990s as a hope for a day of global peace and unity on the first day of the year.
holidays.funFact: Despite being celebrated globally, Global Family Day is not universally known, but it serves as a beautiful reminder for worldwide fellowship and compassion.

holidays.name: Polar Bear Plunge Day
holidays.description: Adventurous and brave souls dive into freezing cold water pools, lakes, or oceans to celebrate the New Year with a chilly shock and invigorating start.
holidays.origin: Started as a tradition among winter swimmers and later became institutionalized as charity events or dares on New Year's Day in various communities.
holidays.funFact: Some polar bear plunges raise millions of dollars for charity, proving freezing your toes off can warm hearts!

holidays.name: Day of Strawberries
holidays.description: A fun and fruity celebration welcoming the first strawberry harvest of the year, with strawberry-themed treats and festivities.
holidays.origin: Started in some agricultural communities as a way to honor and enjoy the arrival of fresh strawberries in early winter climates.
holidays.funFact: Strawberries are the only fruit with seeds on the outside, and each berry has around 200 seeds!
